definitions.definition: A structure built or serving as an abode of human beings.
definitions.example: This is my house and my family's ancestral home.

definitions.definition: The people who live in a house; a household.
A building used for something other than a residence (typically with qualifying word).
definitions.example: On arriving at the zoo, we immediately headed for the monkey house.

definitions.definition: The audience for a live theatrical or similar performance.
A theatre.
definitions.example: After her swan-song, there wasn't a dry eye in the house.

definitions.definition: A building where a deliberative assembly meets; whence the assembly itself, particularly a component of a legislature.
definitions.example: The petition was so ridiculous that the house rejected it after minimal debate.

definitions.definition: A dynasty; a family with its ancestors and descendants, especially a royal or noble one.
definitions.example: A curse lay upon the House of Atreus.

definitions.definition: A place of rest or repose.
A grouping of schoolchildren for the purposes of competition in sports and other activities.
definitions.example: I was a member of Spenser house when I was at school.

definitions.definition: An animal's shelter or den, or the shell of an animal such as a snail, used for protection.
One of the twelve divisions of an astrological chart.
The fourth Lenormand card.
A square on a chessboard, regarded as the proper place of a piece.
The four concentric circles where points are scored on the ice.
Lotto; bingo.
A children's game in which the players pretend to be members of a household.
definitions.example: As the babysitter, Emma always acted as the mother whenever the kids demanded to play house.

definitions.definition: A small stand of trees in a swamp.
(sudoku) A set of cells in a Sudoku puzzle which must contain each digit exactly once, such as a row, column, or 3Ã—3 box in classic Sudoku.
To keep within a structure or container.
definitions.example: The car is housed in the garage.

definitions.definition: To admit to residence; to harbor/harbour.
To take shelter or lodging; to abide; to lodge.
To dwell within one of the twelve astrological houses.
To contain or cover mechanical parts.
To drive to a shelter.
To deposit and cover, as in the grave.
To stow in a safe place; to take down and make safe.
To eat.
